pullRequest.body:
+ Add `IsAtomic.exists_atom`: a nontrivial atomic partial order has an atom, and the dual statement.

+ Since the submodule lattice of a semisimple module is atomistic, deduce that every submodule is the sum of its simple submodules, and that any nontrivial submodule has a simple submodule.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9437110201/job/25992609083)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9437110201/job/25992609147)

I'm following [IsAtomic.isCoatomic_dual](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Atoms.html#IsAtomic.isCoatomic_dual) and [IsCoatomistic.isAtomistic_dual](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Atoms.html#IsCoatomistic.isAtomistic_dual) etc.
If you want to rename all these, maybe open a separate PR, as I'm not sure if a Zulip discussion/vote would be necessary for a maintainer to approve it.
I think all those names are pretty clearly against the convention, but sure I'll open a separate PR. Please remove this change from yours to avoid conflicts

```suggestion
theorem exists_simple_submodule [Nontrivial M] : âˆƒ m : Submodule R M, IsSimpleModule R m := by
```
